poem:
### Complaints Against the Current

A gaslit morning unfolds,  
claims like thin fog  
cling to vested breaths—  
political specters  
in suits of spun promise,  

Yet the earth whispers  
truth with each  
resolute tremor,  

While voices rise,  
cross the wires  
to seek a hearing,  
seek a clearing—  
light and air  
beyond partisanship,  
beyond the haze.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pro-gas group with link to Liberal party referred to ACCC over alleged misleading claims The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) has been asked to investigate allegedly misleading claims made by Australians for Natural Gas, a pro-gas group with directors who include a gas industry executive and a Liberal candidate running in the federal election. Lawyers acting for Climate Integrity, a not-for-profit focused on corporate accountability, have filed a complaint with the ACCC. They argue". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
